Replies.Author: Jack
Replies.Content: You may have noticed that I didn‚Äôt actually skip number 9. This is because I am an idiot who didn‚Äôt bother to proofread his own titles.

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content:
Iron Man was the most hilariously bad attempt at a Japanese studio attempting an American comic book character I‚Äôve seen, but we might have another winner with Wolverine. We‚Äôll see. I watched past ep 1 of iron man and deeply regretted it. Remember, when you‚Äôre anime club president, you better watch EVERYthing. Otherwise, you‚Äôre just not doing your job.

Megane na kanojo was good. Glasses girls are hawwwwwwt~. Jack, do me a favor and never sing that song at meeting. Singing it to myself in my room was enough.

Kaichou‚Äôs spot is well deserved. For being another classical shoujo, it did a hell of a job. I think it helped that I had low standards going in (see: J.C. Staff‚Äôs previous shoujo, ‚ÄúSpecial A‚Äù which was far more rageworthy).

Kuragehime‚Äôs OP is the only thing I really remember, because it was 10^awesome, but I wouldn‚Äôt relate it to Ore Imo insofar as both having otaku girls. Kuragehime was a lot of fujoshi pandering, with the overall message that ‚Äúbeing into that stuff is ok‚Äù plot has literally nothing to do with the theme in Ore Imo which I can only describe as ‚Äúbeing an anime fan really sucks sometimes.‚Äù

I mean, seriously, ‚ÄúIt shows off the misunderstanding/distrust directed at otaku in Japan today, in a reasonably believable fashion; there‚Äôs just not enough of it.‚Äù Are you blind? It had otaku satire out the butthole! You even mention the Meruru being for man-dudes rather than for little girls as it first appears, but don‚Äôt notice the thousands upon thousands of nods of Japanese otaku culture in each ep. I personally put it so high on my list _because_ of the sheer amount of satire. I don‚Äôt expect to change your opinion regarding the show this semester when I feed every single episode down your throat a second time, but hopefully you‚Äôll hear me out when I delve into why the show did what it did. God, Kuragehime was such fan-pandering, you‚Äôre better off comparing it to PSG. We‚Äôll be watching jelly queen this semester.

Idk what ur talkin‚Äô bout Jack, I saw drool on the BD. Wait, that‚Äôs my drool. Lemme clean that‚Ä¶

Katanagatari was like watching a book, but it was at least a decent book with really pretty art. It just suffers from bad pacing, in my opinion. If only for the literary merit, I liked the ending, but otherwise, yeah, monitor-punching level of rage.

Your PSG argument holds very little water only because its far easier to argue the opposite. PSG had the sex jokes, overemphasized sex scenes, and over-the-top fights to directly appeal to a well-defined fanbase. It gets props only for not trying to pretend otherwise. The fact that all the above was built up to the last episode where the dam broke supports the contrary. It‚Äôs not like panty and stocking realized at the end what disgusting sinners they were and sought reconciliation. Rather, the message was that they were girls and they‚Äôll ‚Äúdo what they want because f\*\*k it.‚Äù I‚Äôd buy that argument for the three-part chuck episode, which was a nice satire of DEEP, but most of the time it was basically directors experimenting on the PSG operating table. Still excited for the second season? I doubt they would‚Äôve planned on it if they were giving otaku fans the middle finger for liking it.

I deeply regret showing the camrip of Disappearance, if only because I feel it may have caused you to throw it so low on the list. I don‚Äôt regret getting all of Tatami on the hard drive, I‚Äôm glad you liked it.

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content: By the way, that middle finger to the otaku fanbase didn‚Äôt come from PSG, it was in OreImo. Just thought I‚Äôd point that out.

Replies.Author: Jack
Replies.Content:
Yeah, the PSG thing is a terrible theory. Looking back on what I wrote, I played it up as ‚Äúinteresting‚Äù when I think I should have instead called it more ‚Äúfunny‚Äù that Gainax would try for another highbrow deconstruction by putting together the most racy, offensive, lowbrow show imaginable. The show was ridiculous, don‚Äôt-think-about-it-too-hard FUN, and trying to imagine that as some sort of DEEP criticism of something makes me chuckle every time I think of it. Sorry about my DERP moment in expressing that.

Having had time to let my haterade for Kirino/Kyousuke simmer down a bit, I‚Äôll be giving OreImo a second chance at the showings. Having already complained enough about how I didn‚Äôt enjoy it much, maybe I‚Äôll be able to better see what I was complaining about missing in the list. I really would like to be able to bump it above Kuragehime. Come to think of it, if I could manage that, Kuragehime would likely fall to #10 or off the list entirely; it‚Äôs mostly where it is at this point as a contrast point to OreImo. (Although I did honestly enjoy it)

I‚Äôm not sure skipping the camrip would have made me put Disappearance much higher. It _might_ have slipped past Angel Beats, but I‚Äôm doubtful I would have liked it better than Katanagatari. I can‚Äôt say much except to repeat myself that it‚Äôs just _more Haruhi_, for better and worse.

Replies.Author: steve
Replies.Content:
For some reason‚Ä¶ people either really like OreImo, or really hate it. Appearantly we‚Äôre in the minority, Gene xp. Also obligatory, no Shiki again? De feck?

I don‚Äôt think PSG deserves to be on anybodys‚Äô top 10 list outside of honorable mention. There were 3 good episodes (1, 6 (Scanty and Kneesocks), and 13) and the end of 13 made me rage so hard that I almost broke my computer (by the way, season 2‚Ä≤s official title is Panty vs. Stocking). GAINAX BE TROLLING YO.

I‚Äôm glad somebody else liked Katanagatari. Historical fiction is definitely one of my favorite genres. The ninjas were definitely a highlight. Every time a new one was introduced all I could think was, ‚Äúwut‚Ä¶‚Äù

I watched the first episode of Ironman raw, just because I could. It should be noted, that was the only episode of Ironman I watched. The raw was enough for me to decide that the premise of the show was not ‚ÄúTony Stark goes to Japan to expand his business and bring notoriety to Ironman,‚Äù but rather ‚ÄúRobert Downey Jr. goes to Japan.‚Äù Shows that are this bad make you wonder why Madhouse ever signed an agreement with Marvel to bring American superheroes to anime; AND THEY DID IT FOR 4 SERIES. That‚Äôs right, there‚Äôs two more on the way. =(

I‚Äôm excited to rewatch OreImo at the showings. Definitely one of the better shows from this past year.

Oh, also, since the winter season sucks so much ass (minus Madoka ofc), the spring chart is already out. [http://thecartdriver.com/charts/spring-2011-v1-2/](http://thecartdriver.com/charts/spring-2011-v1-2/) Still incomplete, but this is what‚Äôs been announced so far. Maybe I‚Äôll get Gene to let me make a post about what to watch, or I‚Äôll just wait till he does and then take up a foot of the webpage in the comments lol.

Replies.Author: Jack
Replies.Content:
Shiki‚Äôs not on my list because I haven‚Äôt actually watched it yet. üòõ

I was waiting for it to finish so I could just marathon the whole thing. Which I will do as soon as a batch torrent goes up or I go grab it off the drive (assuming it‚Äôs one there).

Replies.Author: steve
Replies.Content: If Gene doesn‚Äôt have it (pretty sure he does), I do. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs not a batch, I just checked. umee.is-fabulo.us

Replies.Author: Gene
Replies.Content:
Yeah, this season makes me kind of sad. I‚Äôll be making a post on spring and this season and all those little things that frustrate me.

Shiki‚Äôs on the drive, all 22 eps. I have a feeling there‚Äôll be one more with the bluray.

Replies.Author: Grant Walker
Replies.Content:
Another interesting list, even though I haven‚Äôt actually watched more than half of the things on it. It was a nice read, at least. Always good to see Tatami Galaxy on top, too!

I don‚Äôt really have any clever or intelligent things to contribute, but Break Blade‚Äôs placement does baffle me, since I didn‚Äôt think it was _that_ good looking. If anything, I thought the cumbersome robots made battle look kind of clunky and boring (I mean, clunky can be interesting, but I didn‚Äôt find Break Blade to be, I guess).

Still, it‚Äôs not like I can exactly contest the list since, like I said, haven‚Äôt seen most of the things‚Äìkind of neat to see some stuff that wasn‚Äôt on any previous lists, though.

I‚Äôd hunt myself a cookie, but I skipped the Katanagatari section almost entirely, since that‚Äôs one of the shows I do plan to watch later.
